alert.note: Alert for Runnels (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 27 at 6:50PM CDT until further notice by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Coleman and Runnels. * WHEN...Until 800 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 648 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms...from Valera to Santa Anna This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Anna and Fisk. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... FM 1176 crossing Sweetie Creek, CR 270 crossing Home Creek, CR 116 crossing Pony Creek, County Road 300 crossing Home Creek and crossings along County Road 128. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
